sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
An alarme to awake church-sleepers. Describing the causes, discovering the dangers, prescribing remedies for this drowsie disease.
[12], 160 p.
Printed for Matthew Symmons in Gold-Smiths Alleyan Red-Crosse Street, London : 1644.
"Published, perused & amended for the benefit of all those that are either infected herewith or in danger so to bee." Place and date of publication suggested by Wing (2nd ed.). Includes errata: p. 12. Imperfect: pages are stained and tightly bound with some loss of print. Reproduction of original in: Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
=======

[12], 160 p.
Printed for Matthew Symmons in Gold-Smiths Alleyan Red-Crosse Street, London : 1644.
"Published, perused & amended for the benefit of all those that are either infected herewith or in danger so to bee." Place and date of publication suggested by Wing (2nd ed.). Includes errata: p. 12. Imperfect: pages are stained and tightly bound with some loss of print. Reproduction of original in: Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
